SEARCH
Package controller

Class ToyManager

java.lang.Object
controller.ToyManager
public class ToyManager extends Object
Manages the toy inventory, including loading data from file and displaying the main menu. ToyManager reads the toy data from `toys.txt`, creates Toy objects, and provides a menu interface for user interaction.
Version:
2.0
Author:
Justin, Fatema, Manveet

    • FILE_PATH

      private static final String FILE_PATH
      See Also:

    • menu

      private AppMenu menu

    • input

      private Scanner input

    • toys

      private ArrayList<Toy> toys

  • Constructor Details

    • ToyManager

      public ToyManager()
      Constructor that loads data from the file and launches the application. Initializes the application by loading toys from `toys.txt` and starting the main menu.

  • Method Details

    • loadData

      private void loadData()
      Loads toy data from the `toys.txt` file. Each line in the file is parsed to create a specific Toy object based on the serial number prefix. Logs an error if parsing fails for any line.

    • createNewFile

      private void createNewFile(File file)
      Creates a new file if it does not exist.
      Parameters:
      file - The file to create.

    • parseFileData

      private void parseFileData(File file)
      Parses existing toy data from file and loads it into the inventory. Each line in the file is parsed to create a specific Toy object based on the serial number prefix. If an error occurs in parsing, it is logged for review.
      Parameters:
      file - The file containing toy data.

    • launchApp

      private void launchApp()
      Launches the main application menu, allowing users to interact with the toy inventory. Options include searching for toys, adding or removing toys, gift suggestion, and exiting the application.

    • handleSearch

      private void handleSearch()
      Handles the search functionality based on the user's choice in the search menu. The user is returned to the main menu only if they explicitly select "Back to Main Menu".

    • searchBySerialNumber

      private List<Toy> searchBySerialNumber(String serialNumber)
      Searches for toys by their serial number.
      Parameters:
      serialNumber - The serial number of the toy to search for.
      Returns:
      A list of toys matching the given serial number. Returns an empty list if no matches are found.

    • searchByName

      private List<Toy> searchByName(String toyName)
      Searches for toys by their name.
      Parameters:
      toyName - The name (or partial name) of the toy to search for.
      Returns:
      A list of toys whose names contain the given input (case-insensitive). Returns an empty list if no matches are found.

    • searchByType

      private List<Toy> searchByType(String type)
      Searches for toys by their type.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the toy to search for (e.g., "Puzzle", "Figure").
      Returns:
      A list of toys matching the given type (case-insensitive). Returns an empty list if no matches are found.

    • processSearchChoice

      private void processSearchChoice(int choice, List<Toy> filteredResults)
      Processes the user's choice from the search results. If a toy is selected, it decrements the stock count and removes the toy from the inventory if the count reaches zero. If the user chooses the "Back to Search Menu" option, they are returned to the search menu.
      Parameters:
      choice - The user's choice as an integer.
      filteredResults - The list of toys displayed as search results.

    • addToy

      private void addToy()
      Handles the addition of a new toy to the inventory. Prompts the user for toy details, starting with validating the serial number. Each validation check includes user feedback, and the user is re-prompted until valid input is received.

    • getValidatedSerialNumber

      private String getValidatedSerialNumber()
      Validates the format of a serial number. Ensures the serial number contains only digits and is exactly 10 digits long.
      Returns:
      A valid serial number as a String.

    • isSerialNumberUnique

      private boolean isSerialNumberUnique(String sn)
      Checks if a serial number is unique in the inventory.
      Parameters:
      sn - The serial number to check.
      Returns:
      true if the serial number is unique, false otherwise.

    • getValidatedPrice

      private double getValidatedPrice()
      Prompts the user to enter a valid price. Ensures that the price is non-negative, and handles any invalid inputs or negative values with a custom exception.
      Returns:
      A validated price as a double.

    • getValidatedNonNegativeInt

      private int getValidatedNonNegativeInt()
      Helper method to validate non-negative integer input. This method prompts the user for input, ensures it is non-negative, and re-prompts if the input is invalid.
      Returns:
      A validated non-negative integer.

    • getValidatedToyType

      private String getValidatedToyType()
      Prompts the user to enter a valid toy type. This method ensures that the toy type matches one of the predefined types (e.g., "Figure", "Animal", "Puzzle", "BoardGame").
      Returns:
      A validated toy type as a String.

    • getValidatedFigureToy

      private Toy getValidatedFigureToy(String sn, String name, String brand, double price, int availableCounts, int appropriateAge)
      Prompts the user to enter and validate all fields required to create a Figure toy. Ensures that the classification is one of 'A', 'D', or 'H' (case-insensitive).
      Parameters:
      sn - The serial number of the toy.
      name - The name of the toy.
      brand - The brand of the toy.
      price - The price of the toy.
      availableCounts - The available stock count for the toy.
      appropriateAge - The minimum appropriate age for the toy.
      Returns:
      A newly created Figure toy with validated fields.

    • getValidatedAnimalToy

      private Toy getValidatedAnimalToy(String sn, String name, String brand, double price, int availableCounts, int appropriateAge)
      Prompts the user to enter and validate all fields required to create an Animal toy. Ensures that the material is not empty and the size is one of 'S', 'M', or 'L' (case-insensitive).
      Parameters:
      sn - The serial number of the toy.
      name - The name of the toy.
      brand - The brand of the toy.
      price - The price of the toy.
      availableCounts - The available stock count for the toy.
      appropriateAge - The minimum appropriate age for the toy.
      Returns:
      A newly created Animal toy with validated fields.

    • getValidatedPuzzleToy

      private Toy getValidatedPuzzleToy(String sn, String name, String brand, double price, int availableCounts, int appropriateAge)
      Prompts the user to enter and validate all fields required to create a Puzzle toy. Ensures that the puzzle type is one of 'M', 'C', 'L', 'T', or 'R' (case-insensitive).
      Parameters:
      sn - The serial number of the toy.
      name - The name of the toy.
      brand - The brand of the toy.
      price - The price of the toy.
      availableCounts - The available stock count for the toy.
      appropriateAge - The minimum appropriate age for the toy.
      Returns:
      A newly created Puzzle toy with validated fields.

    • getValidatedBoardGameToy

      private Toy getValidatedBoardGameToy(String sn, String name, String brand, double price, int availableCounts, int appropriateAge)
      Prompts the user to enter and validate all fields required to create a Board Game toy. Ensures that the minimum number of players does not exceed the maximum and that designer names are input correctly.
      Parameters:
      sn - The serial number of the toy.
      name - The name of the toy.
      brand - The brand of the toy.
      price - The price of the toy.
      availableCounts - The available stock count for the toy.
      appropriateAge - The minimum appropriate age for the toy.
      Returns:
      A newly created BoardGame toy with validated fields.

    • removeToy

      private void removeToy()
      Handles the removal of a toy from the inventory by serial number. Prompts the user for the serial number, displays the toy if found, and asks for confirmation to remove it.

    • suggestGift

      private void suggestGift()
      Provides a gift suggestion based on optional age, type, and price range criteria. The user can input any combination of criteria, or leave 1-2 of them empty. Shows a list of suggestions that match the input criteria.

    • getOptionalPrice

      private Double getOptionalPrice()
      Prompts the user to enter a price, allowing them to skip by pressing Enter. Ensures the price is non-negative if provided, and handles invalid input.
      Returns:
      A validated price as a Double, or null if skipped.

    • getOptionalNonNegativeInt

      private Integer getOptionalNonNegativeInt()
      Prompts the user to enter a non-negative integer, allowing them to skip by pressing Enter. Ensures the integer is non-negative if provided, and handles invalid input.
      Returns:
      A validated non-negative integer, or null if skipped.

    • getOptionalToyType

      private String getOptionalToyType()
      Prompts the user to enter a toy type or skip. This method ensures that if a toy type is entered, it matches one of the predefined types (e.g., "Figure", "Animal", "Puzzle", "BoardGame"). If no input is provided, the method returns null, indicating no preference.
      Returns:
      A validated toy type as a String, or null if the user skips the input.

    • filterToysByCriteria

      private List<Toy> filterToysByCriteria(Integer minAge, Double maxPrice, String toyType)
      Filters the toys list based on the specified criteria.
      Parameters:
      minAge - The minimum age for the toy (can be null if not specified).
      maxPrice - The maximum price for the toy (can be null if not specified).
      toyType - The toy type to filter by (can be null if not specified).
      Returns:
      A list of toys matching the criteria.

    • completePurchase

      private void completePurchase(Toy toy)
      Completes the purchase for the selected toy.
      Parameters:
      toy - The toy the user has chosen to purchase.

    • updateData

      private void updateData()
      Updates the current list of toys to the `toys.txt` file. This method iterates over the `toys` list and writes each toy's data to the file.
